to.personal: Google Webmaster Help - Crawling, indexing, and ranking

headers.to: "Google Webmaster Help - Crawling, indexing, and ranking" <ignore@markmail.org>
headers.subject: Is sandbox real?
headers.received: (from crawler@localhost) by crawl-1.a.markmail.int (8.13.8/8.13.8/Submit) id m8NKVSwn009684 for stacy.watts.bender@a.markmail.org; Tue, 23 Sep 2008 13:31:28 -0700
headers.x-authentication-warning: crawl-1.a.markmail.int: crawler set sender to root@localhost using -r
headers.x-http-useragent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.0; en-US; rv:1.9.0.1) Gecko/2008070208 Firefox/3.0.1,gzip(gfe),gzip(gfe)

body.para: I'm the owner of a new blog (http://otinanainews.com) and my site was recently indexed by google. However i'm able to find my site only when i use the title as a search term. None of my posts are indexed. I read somewhere about the term sandbox and i was wondering if this is the case. I had the same blog with a different domain name for a month and i had to change it. In the first domain my posts were indexed from the first couple of days and many of them were no1 in the search results.
